role="header" optional="false"> <Body>Decoding an Empire: Mysteries of the Khipu</Body> <Source>SA Cultural innovation text.docx</Source> </TextBlock> <TextBlock id="txt_intro" role="intro" optional="false"> <Body>High in the Andes, the Inca built a vast empire without a written alphabet. Instead, they relied on khipus—bundles of knotted cords—to track harvests, population counts, and taxes. Specially trained “khipucamayocs” tied each knot in a base-ten system, turning colorful threads into data. Many of these knotted records survive, but their full meaning remains a riddle scientists are still working to solve.</Body> <Source>SA Cultural innovation text.docx</Source> </TextBlock> <TextBlock id="txt_panel_1" role="panel_caption" optional="false"> <Heading>Ancient Writings Decoded</Heading> <Body>Across the world, ancient scripts—cuneiform in Sumer, hieroglyphs in Egypt, alphabets in Greece and China—have been passed down through generations. We can still read most of these texts today, thanks to centuries of careful preservation.</Body> <Source>SA Cultural innovation text.docx</Source> </TextBlock> <TextBlock id="txt_panel_2" role="panel_caption" optional="false"> <Heading>Spanish Arrival and Tragic Loss</Heading> <Body>When the Spanish arrived in the Andes, they brought diseases that devastated the Inca, including the expert khipucamayocs. Conquistadores also burned many khipus, leaving only a handful in museums and labs. Even now, we’re not entirely sure how to read them.</Body> <Source>SA Cultural innovation text.docx</Source> </TextBlock> <TextBlock id="txt_panel_3" role="panel_caption" optional="false"> <Heading>Knots and Binary</Heading> <Body>Despite the destruction, the logic behind khipus is clear. Their “knotted code” mirrors modern data systems, using positions and patterns much like binary. Some computer scientists even say khipu ideas influenced today’s coding techniques.</Body> <Source>SA Cultural innovation text.docx</Source> </TextBlock> <TextBlock id="txt_panel_4" role="panel_caption" optional="false"> <Heading>Mysteries Waiting in the Knots</Heading> <Body>What hidden stories remain in these cords? From royal histories to population records, each strand may hold truths we have yet to uncover. The khipu’s final secrets still wait to be untangled.</Body> <Source>SA Cultural innovation text.docx</Source> </TextBlock> </TextBlocks> <ReflectionQuestions> <Question>How does the khipu challenge
